intro: Melampyrum arvense subvar. lasistanicum, commonly known as yellow false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and waste areas. The species is notable for its parasitic nature, drawing nutrients from the roots of other plants.
